DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Segment Liquid Nitrogen Vapor Date and Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date or date and time the malignant neoplasm tissue was frozen with Liquid Nitrogen Vapor (LN2 Vapor).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._The gaseous state of liquid nitrogen with a temperature of -167 degrees Celsius.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The gaseous state of liquid nitrogen with a temperature of -167 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: The gaseous state of liquid nitrogen with a temperature of -167 degrees Celsius.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date or date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)
